Overview.Summary: The 2024 Slovak presidential election is in its first round of voting, with pro-Western candidate Ivan Korcok leading the preliminary results (1). The election is particularly significant due to the recent assassination attempt on Prime Minister Robert Fico (3, 6, 8), who has been in office since 2012 and is known for his pro-Russia stance (4). Fico's political party has pledged to stop migration and discontinue help to Ukraine, which has been battling Russia's invasion (5). Other candidates have also been approved to run for president in snap elections following the death of the previous president (7). The 2024 presidential election calendar has been released, including key dates such as debates, primary elections, and the general election (9).

Overview.Summary: The 2024 Slovak presidential election will take place on March 23 and April 6, with a possible runoff on May 5 if necessary (3,4). The main conditions for candidacy are a petition signed by 15,000 voters or 15 MPs (1). The two leading candidates are the oldest pairing in American history (6). Ivan Korčok may appeal the decision to disqualify him as a candidate (1). Volodymyr Zelensky's presidential term will expire on May 20 (2). Michal Kováč, the first Slovak president, received 8 percent of the vote in a recent poll (9). Peter Pellegrini, a former premier and member of Fico's ruling coalition, secured 53.1 percent of the vote in the first round of the 2024 Slovak presidential election (5).

Timeline.Text: The oldest pairing of candidates in American history is announced for the 2024 U.S. presidential election.
Ten candidates qualify for the ballot in the 2024 Slovak presidential election.
Michal Kováč, the first Slovak president, is ranked as the least popular president in a poll.
The results of the first round of the 2024 Slovak presidential election are announced.
In the 2024 Slovak presidential election, Peter Pellegrini wins with 53.12% of the vote.
Slovakia elects a president supportive of Russia.
Volodymyr Zelensky's presidential term expires on May 20th.
Ukraine's President Zelenskyy announces the suspension of Ukrainian elections in November.
The U.S. presidential election of 1912 is won by Theodore Roosevelt.

Overview.Summary: The 2024 Slovak presidential election will take place on March 23, with 10 candidates qualifying for the ballot (2,6). Peter Pellegrini, a close ally of populist Prime Minister Robert Fico, was elected as Slovakia's new president (3,4). A poll showed that Pellegrini was the preferred candidate for most Slovaks (10). Current President Zuzana Čaputová's mandate ends in 2024 and she has announced that she will not run again (5). The formal inauguration ceremony for Pellegrini will take place on June 15 (18).

Timeline.Text: Slovak president urges lawmakers to reconsider plans to scrap a special prosecution office for high crimes and lower sentences for financial crimes, as tens of thousands protest in opposition.
The speaker of parliament announces the date of the Slovak presidential election.
Ten candidates qualify for the ballot in the Slovak presidential election.

Former Slovak parliament speaker Peter Pellegrini, an ally of outgoing Prime Minister Robert Fico, will face off against liberal ex-foreign minister Ivan Korcok in the first round of the country's presidential election.
Slovakia will elect its sixth president, with Peter Pellegrini defeating Ivan Korcok in the runoff.
Former speaker of parliament and Prime Minister Robert Fico's ally Peter Pellegrini will officially become the new Slovak president.
Slovakian President-elect Peter Pellegrini is sworn in next to Constitutional Court chair Ivan Fiacan at the ceremonial inaugural session of Parliament.
England beats Slovakia in dramatic fashion during Euro 2024.
